_header: O my desire what aileth thee
_description: A lover’s complaint — two 8-line stanzas with refrain: ‘O my desyre what wylyth the’

BLAdd5465.Note:
With music in two voices credited to William Newark, though the upper
                    voice of the first half is lost, as is the lower voice of the second
                    half.
BLAdd5465.Editions:
Fehr,  Bernhard. 
             “Die Lieder des Fairfax MS (Add. 5465 Brit. Mus.).” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         106 (1901): 48-70: 53.
Stevens,  John,
                        ed.  
             Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court.
         London: Methuen, 1961: 354.
